meanings.sent1: The children told stories of a bogy that haunted the old house.
meanings.sent2: The bogy in the tale was a wicked creature that scared everyone.
meanings.sent3: The bogy played pranks on the villagers, making them jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The bogy of the forest whispered eerie secrets to those who dared to listen.
meanings.sent5: The bogy's glowing eyes in the dark were a terrifying sight.

meanings.definition: A cause of fear or alarm
meanings.sent1: The strange noise in the attic turned out to be just a bogy.
meanings.sent2: The shadowy figure lurking in the alley was a bogy to the townspeople.
meanings.sent3: The bogy of bad luck seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: The looming storm clouds were a bogy warning of the approaching tempest.
meanings.sent5: The sudden creaking of the floorboards was a bogy that made her heart race.

meanings.definition: To act in a deceptive or dishonest manner
meanings.sent1: He tried to bogy his way out of trouble by telling a white lie.
meanings.sent2: She would often bogy her friends into believing her tall tales.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox would bogy the other animals with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: The con artist would bogy unsuspecting victims with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent5: The magician would bogy the audience with his amazing illusions.
